main event: On 19 June 1960, an unidentified object was spotted approximately 18 miles west of Medina, Saudi Arabia by a patrol radar. The object appeared round, metallic, and very bright, reflecting sunlight, with no visible means of propulsion. It accelerated away at tremendous speed and left no vapor trail.
interesting points: The UFO report was from 19 June 1960 in Saudi Arabia, where an unidentified round, metallic, and very bright object was observed accelerating away at tremendous speed.
The object was initially detected by a patrol radar approximately 18 miles west of Medina, Saudi Arabia.
Visual sighting of the object was made by the crew standing guard at the location, confirming the radar detection.
The object had no jet, propeller, or other visible means of propulsion and left no vapor trail, indicating unconventional movement.
The incident was reported to the Saudi Arabian government and recommended to be included in Project Blue Book records.
sighted object: unidentified round, metallic, and very bright object
witnesses: patrol radar crew and personnel standing guard
